page.title: 20LOCAL NEWS.
page.content: We have recorded some items of local news from June 12th-19th, 1985. A public appeal was launched to raise Â£1.25m. for a 16-bed hospice to bo built on a site next to Pxpn Hall. House building at Gains Park continues with 5 new designs being advertised. Houses and bungalows are for sale at Alverley Close ranging from Â£43,000 to Â£55,000 in price. 2-bedroom apartments at Mytton Oak, Copthorne start from Â£20,380. A draft plan has been agreed for a 25-acre housing development at Shelton and an 18-acre industrial area. The River Severn is rising because of heavy showers. It is 6 feet above normal height. A community centre for Gains Park has been approved. Staff at Marks & Spencer raised Â£2,000 for a roundabout at Mytton Oak Centre.
